title: Ottoman and Mughal Images Gunpowder MCQ 1

content.description:
Image 1:

OTTOMAN SOLDIERS RECONQUERING A FORTRESS IN GREECE FROM VENETIAN FORCES, MINIATURE IN A VENETIAN-PRODUCED BOOK OF HISTORY AND DIPLOMACY, CIRCA 1665

DEA/A. DAGLI ORTI/Getty Images

Image 2:

MUGHAL FORCES LED BY THE EMPEROR AURANGZEB CAPTURE THE FORTRESS OF GOLCONDA, CAPITAL OF A RIVAL MUSLIM INDIAN STATE, IN 1687. PAINTING BY AN ANONYMOUS INDIAN ARTIST, CIRCA 1760.

Heritage Images/Getty Images
content.question: Taken together, the two images best support which of the following claims regarding developments in the period from 1450 to 1750 ?

choices.label: European military technology was inferior to Asian military technology.
Rulers served as military commanders and typically led armies into battle themselves.
Gunpowder technology facilitated the expansion of land-based empires.
Religious divisions were not a significant source of military conflict.

content.answer: Gunpowder technology facilitated the expansion of land-based empires.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
